d. w. griffith.gloss: United States film maker who was the first to use flashbacks and fade-outs (1875-1948)

dwarf.gloss: a person who is markedly small
a legendary creature resembling a tiny old man

dwarf-white trillium.gloss: a low perennial white-flowered trillium found in the southeastern United States

dwarf astilbe.gloss: mat-forming evergreen Asiatic plant with finely cut leaves and small pink to burgundy flowers

dwarf banana.gloss: low-growing Asian banana tree cultivated especially in the West Indies for its clusters of edible yellow fruit

dwarf bilberry.gloss: low-growing tufted deciduous shrub of northern and alpine North America having pink to coral-red flowers followed by sweet blue berries

dwarf blueberry.gloss: low-growing tufted deciduous shrub of northern and alpine North America having pink to coral-red flowers followed by sweet blue berries

dwarf buckeye.gloss: a spreading shrub with pink flowers

dwarf buffalo.gloss: small buffalo of the Celebes having small straight horns

dwarf cape gooseberry.gloss: stout hairy annual of eastern North America with sweet yellow fruits

dwarf chestnut.gloss: shrubby chestnut tree of southeastern United States having small edible nuts

dwarf chinkapin oak.gloss: deciduous shrubby tree of northeastern and central United States having a sweet edible nut and often forming dense thickets

dwarf chinquapin oak.gloss: deciduous shrubby tree of northeastern and central United States having a sweet edible nut and often forming dense thickets

dwarf cornel.gloss: creeping perennial herb distinguished by red berries and clustered leaf whorls at the tips of shoots

dwarf daisy.gloss: tiny grey woolly tufted annual with small golden-yellow flower heads

dwarf dandelion.gloss: small yellow-flowered herb resembling dandelions of central and southeastern United States

dwarf elder.gloss: dwarf herbaceous elder of Europe having pink flowers and a nauseous odor
bristly herb of eastern and central North America having black fruit and medicinal bark

dwarf elm.gloss: fast-growing shrubby Asian tree naturalized in United States for shelter or ornament

dwarf flowering almond.gloss: small Chinese shrub with smooth unfurrowed dark red fruit grown especially for its red or pink or white flowers

dwarf golden chinkapin.gloss: evergreen shrub similar to golden chinkapin

dwarf gray willow.gloss: willow shrub of dry places in the eastern United States having long narrow leaves canescent beneath

dwarf grey willow.gloss: willow shrub of dry places in the eastern United States having long narrow leaves canescent beneath

dwarf hulsea.gloss: similar to but smaller than alpine hulsea

dwarf iris.gloss: low-growing spring-flowering American iris with bright blue-lilac flowers
low-growing summer-flowering iris of northeastern United States

dwarf juniper.gloss: a procumbent variety of the common juniper

dwarf lycopod.gloss: tufted spikemoss forming loose spreading mats

dwarf maple.gloss: small maple of northwestern North America

dwarf mountain pine.gloss: low shrubby pine of central Europe with short bright green needles in bunches of two

dwarf mulberry.gloss: creeping raspberry of north temperate regions with yellow or orange berries

dwarf nipplewort.gloss: small European herb with small yellow flowers

dwarf oak.gloss: deciduous shrubby tree of northeastern and central United States having a sweet edible nut and often forming dense thickets

dwarf phlox.gloss: low tufted perennial phlox with needlelike evergreen leaves and pink or white flowers

dwarf pipefish.gloss: small (4 inches) fish found off the Florida Gulf Coast

dwarf russian almond.gloss: Asiatic shrub cultivated for its rosy red flowers

dwarf sperm whale.gloss: very small (to 8 feet) sperm whale of central coasts of Atlantic and Pacific

dwarf spurge.gloss: European erect or depressed annual weedy spurge adventive in northeastern United States

dwarf sumac.gloss: common nonpoisonous shrub of eastern North America with compound leaves and green paniculate flowers followed by red berries

dwarf willow.gloss: widely distributed boreal shrubby willow with partially underground creeping stems and bright green glossy leaves

dwarfism.gloss: a genetic abnormality resulting in short stature

dweeb.gloss: an insignificant student who is ridiculed as being affected or boringly studious

dweller.gloss: a person who inhabits a particular place

dwelling.gloss: housing that someone is living in

dwelling house.gloss: housing that someone is living in

dwight d. eisenhower.gloss: United States general who supervised the invasion of Normandy and the defeat of Nazi Germany

dwight david eisenhower.gloss: United States general who supervised the invasion of Normandy and the defeat of Nazi Germany

dwight davis.gloss: United States tennis player who donated the Davis Cup for international team tennis competition (1879-1945)

dwight eisenhower.gloss: United States general who supervised the invasion of Normandy and the defeat of Nazi Germany

dwight filley davis.gloss: United States tennis player who donated the Davis Cup for international team tennis competition (1879-1945)

dwell.gloss: think moodily or anxiously about something
be an inhabitant of or reside in
